website_summaries.verdict: A hearty bag with a soft interior and tough exterior. The best bargain-priced sleeping bag on the market.
pros: Twin bed dimensions suit taller users and restless sleepers
Use in temperatures as low as 0°F
cons: A little bulkier than the others on our list

customer_reviews.title: Failure, don't waste your money, not as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it zero stars I would. Froze in the 40 to 50 degree range on our first night. We bought a left and right hand zip bags thinking we could zip them together, but when you do the zippers are in the middle not on the sides. There is no insulation in these bags, I can see through them and there is a gap at th e feet, still cold feet even with heavy socks on. Will go back to the old cotton 35 degree bags as they are warmer for car camping.
customer_reviews.author: Danger May

customer_reviews.title: 0 degree F rating? You have to be kidding. Boooo. I'll give it an F rating, how about F-?
customer_reviews.text: I just slep four nights in this thing. First night I was in thermals and it was 38F in the tent and I about froze my butt off. Next night it was 34F and even worse. Third night I drove to Wally World to get some sweats to layer up and it was still not "toasty" and it was 38F again. Fourth night was 44F and finally I slept well enough. Zipper catches the material easily and is a PITA. Also the inner lining is a nylon type material, not a comfy flannel type lining so it's kind of slippery-ish. I am REALLY disappointed in this bag, expected so much more.
customer_reviews.author: LRH

customer_reviews.title: Worst ever! So many reasons...
customer_reviews.text: First of all its so slippery to be in, you get tangled inside and it twists. The chemical smell is horrible and even after airing out for days in the cool fall air, it still smells horrible. Which brings me to the next complain is the fact it is not in any way launderable, not wash or dry clean. Or you voice any warranty. Don't know about you but I like a clean sleeping bag each trip. THEN the zipper broke when opening it and airing it out. All the way around a bad choice. I have Teton everything. But this is going back!
customer_reviews.author: Carole

customer_reviews.title: I am a short but very large man. My ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a short but very large man. My first time using this was on an 8 degree night, outside in Northern Wisconsin in the middle of February. The sleeping bag itself was very warm. I threw a body warmer down by my feet because they always get cold. The dual draw strings allow for sealing up against the cold. I use a portable CPAP when camping and had to keep the machine in the bag with me because it wouldn't operate in the cold otherwise. Plenty of room in this sleeping bag. At 7 pounds I doubt I'll ever take it backpacking, but it will be my go to cold weather car camping bag from now on!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas FlintTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: A DREAM COME TRUE!
customer_reviews.text: I got burned on a sleeping bag before recently that looked nice and big , but turned out to be rather uncomfortable. I plan to go to a anime convention in may and I certainly cannot afford to be with out something to sleep on the somewhat hard hotel floors. I was going to go for an air bed since it's much smaller in my bag, but I rather not deal with the possible chance and so far this is the best solution not only because its super comfy due to it's cushion, but also because I love the colors and want something that feels like it was made for me. Thanks TETON; you guys rock.
customer_reviews.author: Bunshigi Hanumie

customer_reviews.title: Not a warm sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I bough one of these for my daughter and for me. We both used them the same night in the mountains with temperatures in the 40'sF. The bag didn't keep either one of us warm. The fabric is loud and slick. I like to have my cot at a slight angle with my head uphill. One toss or turn and I would slide halfway down the cot. I will be in the market for 2 new sleeping bags. DO NOT buy this product unless you are using for indoor or outdoor use with night time temperatures above 60.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Littlefield

customer_reviews.title: Very warm and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This bag is super warm and very roomy! However, I would not recommend taking this monster along if you have a long trek to your camp site. I’ve used this on numerous occasions in temps around 20 Fahrenheit with no issues of being cold or uncomfortable. My friend has borrowed it several times and her 70lb pit bull was able to sleep comfortably inside with her. Weighing around 8lbs does make this bag a bit cumbersome, but sleeping comfortably/warm makes it worth it! It does come with a stuff sack which you can just shove the bag in unfolded or roll it up neatly.
customer_reviews.author: Majorangejuice

customer_reviews.title: So Comfy & Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Although the exterior material is a bit “slick”, it is Extremely comfortable, warm and very well made. The zipper is heavy duty and zips easily. The storage sack is of very good quality also. Just consider your tent door orientation to your preferred sleeping location since the bag has only 1 zippered side. I camp in a Cabela’s single cot tent and it only has one exit side door. It has a ceiling “window” also on just one end. I ordered a RIGHT zipper side so the window was above my head and the exit door was on the same side as the sleeping bag zipper.
customer_reviews.author: MerriLou

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag but doesn’t keep me warm below 52°
customer_reviews.text: Very nice comfortable bag, but it doesn’t keep you very warm. We did a camping trip where we dipped down to probably 30° at night and that first night I was freezing so the next night I had to wear longjohns and jeans and three or four shirts/sweaters to stay warm. On our second camping trip the dip down to about 46°, even then I have to get up in the middle of the night and put on my jeans and two sweaters on to stay warm
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'1" around 240 lbs and I had plenty of room to move around and sleep any way I wanted. I used this bag in Maine in the fall where the temp was around 30° F and I was very comfortable. I slept on a pad with socks, long johns and a beanie and I probably would've been comfortable down another 10° or more. All around I couldn't have been happier, this is definitely the best bag I've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Bear K

customer_reviews.title: BEST SLEEPING BAG EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best sleeping bag I have ever owned! I've been camping for over 50 years and have never been as warm snug and comfortable as I have since buying this sleeping bag. I love how roomy it is and the fact that it has a built in hood. I usually have to either wear my hoody or stocking cap to bed when I'm cold weather camping but not with this bag... the built in hood keeps me toasty warm and comfortable. I like the fact that if you want you can get a left and right zip bag and put them together. If my wife was still alive she would have loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J Greeson

customer_reviews.title: The quality of Teton 0*F sleeping bag is great it has a nice soft internal lining and the ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband is 6'2'' so he needed the extra length and he said that this worked really well with giving him some extra space and not needing to scrunch up into a ball. The quality of Teton 0*F sleeping bag is great it has a nice soft internal lining and the water proof outside. The storage bag works really well and takes up a smaller amount of space than we are used to having to deal with which was a nice perk. I would definitely recommend these high quality low cost sleeping bags!
customer_reviews.author: cmoulton

customer_reviews.title: Don't unzip it all the way
customer_reviews.text: Though I have Zero complaints about the performance of this bag, my brother made the mistake of unzipping the thing all the way and my retardeness has prevented me from being able to zip it back up and get it back into the tiny storage bag that it came with. No worries as I plan to use it on the bed this winter when me and Mrs H snuggle in our queen size bed during the low temps. It is an awesome bag and I cannot recommend it enough. Just don't unzip it all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Making things simple

customer_reviews.title: Size perfect, warmth perfect, A+++
customer_reviews.text: I am 6'1" with wide shoulders and do not fit comfortably in most regular sized sleeping bags. High was headed to the mountains in Colorado for an elk hunt where the temperatures were going to get down into the single digits. This sleeping bag was long enough to go over my head and even has a drawstring to close off the top portion to keep the cold out better. Wide enough to curl up in a ball if necessary. Size was perfect. Regarding warmth, it kept me 100% warm even with single digit temperatures, and no tent heater. Zipper and material seemed durable, no issues. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Very big and heavy!
customer_reviews.text: If you're doing a lot of car camping/drive in camping, I think this sleeping bag will work well for you. I purposely purchased the XXL size because I tend to roll around while sleeping. There's definitely enough room to do that, but probably not big enough for 2 people. It's been holding up very well and the flannel lining is very nice/comforting when drive in camping. However, it is pretty bulky and heavy (which is completely expected of this), so I would be hesitant to take it anywhere where weight will be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Y

customer_reviews.title: Kept me warm in sub 20 weather
customer_reviews.text: I used this in my RTT on some pretty windy nights in temps ranging from 19-25 degrees. It worked fine and I guess my one complaint would be I wish the storage bag was slightly larger and I wish it had built in straps to hold it once I got it rolled up. Getting the sleeping bag repacked was tantamount to trying to stuff 10 lbs of sh*t in a 5 lb sack. I ultimately just began unzipping it and folding it up with the tent. It's not overly heavy for a cold weather bag, but I didn't hike with it. For the price I think it would be hard to beat for overlanding/car camping.
customer_reviews.author: JPM

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The sleeping bag is very roomy; I'm 5' 10" 190 lbs. and there's lots of room. Be sure of your selection of left or right unzip...if your in the bag face up, right unzip is next to your right arm. Warmth is good, by the way it feels I'm guessing it's as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Siobhan E

customer_reviews.title: I sleep in this instead of my bed
customer_reviews.text: College does as college do and gave me a disgustingly small and cheap bed to sleep in. My own sheets don't fit (as I had my own bed and frame before) and I slip and slide all around on the cheap, weird, synthetic cover over the mat of springs. It sucks. So I sleep in this and sometimes on this instead and am treated to warmth, support, and an extremely comfortable interior lining. Large enough for me to crawl inside, pull a pillow on, and become the sleep burrito I was born to be. Thank you Teton. Thank you very much.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Burt

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for 6'3"!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'3" 215 pounds and fit perfectly. The extension around the head area is my favorite feature. I've used this bag camping in Florida on a 50 degree night and didn't get cold or hot. The material is comfortable. The second time I used it was in the hospital when my daughter was born. I slept good both times. I actually look forward to using it. The bag packs nice and the cinch straps work well for making it pack up small. Couldn't ask for more at this price. Will update after more use.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Very warm, very comfortable and TONS of room!
customer_reviews.text: If you're car camping or don't mind carrying this separately from your backpack (it would take up the whole pack), you'll love this sleeping bag. It's very wam, very comfortable and has tons of room! I got it and opened it up to try it out on my family room floor and was very pleasantly surprised at how big and comfortable it is. My dog jumped in with me and had room to spare. :) I'll be using this for winter camping soon and am very confident I'll be toasty without any additional bivvy or quilt, etc. Get one and enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Cowles

customer_reviews.title: Well Made -- Great Bag for Cold Weather Camping
customer_reviews.text: It's been a year and I'm very happy with this bag. I use it a lot! It's warm and comfy. It is a cold weather bag, so if you think you'll be in 70* nights, plan on sleeping on top or having a warm weather bag. If however you are camping in the cool or cold, this bag is a snuggle bunny! I woke with ice on the inside of my camper windows and was still super comfy in my long johns, beanie and this muffin of a bag. The quality is very good, to the point I'm now shopping other Teton Products based on my faith in them. I recommend this Bag for sure!
customer_reviews.author: 10 Cent Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Imagine being rolled up in a Spider's web
customer_reviews.text: I'll cut right to the point. The inside synthetic "flannel" sticks to clothes, PJ's etc. It's like velvet. SO you're sticking to the inside lining, but then the poly fiber filling is SUPER slippery, so you in your spider's web are slipping all over like a greased pig. It made for lots of tossing and turning and trying to get free of the grippy stuff while sliding all over the air mattress. Plus the zipper wouldn't stay up so I kept having a cold air gap. I'm selling these. Hate em. They're warm, that's all.
customer_reviews.author: IsaBear

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLY FAULTY ZIPPER
customer_reviews.text: Received this within 2 weeks of ordering. Lightweight to carry (storage bag included) Supersoft! Unfolds into a massive bag! I'm a 5 ft 10in woman, average frame and this bag has tons of room. Extremely disappointed that the zipper was difficult and testy. ZIPPER COMPLETELY BROKE AFTER 2 USES.
customer_reviews.author: TRIXZEE

customer_reviews.title: No Zipper On The Bottom
customer_reviews.text: "Unzips at the top or bottom for easy access and ventilation; For camping in 3 seasons" There is no zipper on the bottom,this bag cannot be opened fully.The product description at the top of the page should be updated for accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: steve p

customer_reviews.title: Roomy and warm.
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is soft and comfy and lightweight yet keeps me warm when camping in the Tetons. I am 5 10 and 280 and can sleep on my side comfortably all stretched out and not cramped. A good night sleep is a great start to your day of adventures.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely for cold weather
customer_reviews.text: This is a very warm and toasty sleeping bag. Tried it out as soon as I unboxed it and I could only keep it zipped a few minutes before it became overly hot inside. It is also roomy, I’m just under 300lbs with very wide shoulders and my 12 year old daughter crawled in while I was trying it out. Not only did both fit, she actually was turning from her right side to her left. Only drawback is, we couldn’t get it to compress small enough to fit in my hiking pack.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best sleeping bag ever
customer_reviews.text: Buy this bag, I’m serious. Stop all the research and reading reviews. This is the Mecca of all sleeping bags. I purchased two and two of their pillows. What a great buy. Soft and warm and comfortable. It checks off every mark.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for car camping
customer_reviews.text: At this point, I have purchased three of the Teton Sports XXL sleeping bags. The bags are well made with excellent loft. The biggest selling point, however, is the size. The sleeping bag is very roomy. The bag isn't light enough for backpacking but serves well as a sleeping bag for car camping. The compression sack works very well. The exterior of the bag is a bit slippery so rolling the bag can be challenging depending on the circumstances. The bags are very reasonably priced and work well.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Decker

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for camping
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge! I do not like the small sleeping bags as I feel like my legs are constrainted, and I can't stand that. I don't like my cover tucked in and every sleeping bag I've used, I felt trapped. This has a ton of room for a person with leg issues like me or for a large person. I got it to camp in the Teton's in Wyoming and it kept me warm when the temp got to 39 degrees. Worth the purchase, wish I had bought two to connect them. Will be ordering the other soon!
customer_reviews.author: Shane P.

customer_reviews.title: ZIPPERS SLIP TOO EASY OVERATED RATINGS
customer_reviews.text: ZIPPERS FALL DOWN WAY TO EASY COMPARED TO OTHER QUALITY BRANDED SLEEPING BAGS. THEY DOEST STAY PUT WHERE U LEAVE IT LIKE MY OLD SLUMERJACK QUALITY BAG (ESPECIALLY IF YOU ARE A TOSS AND TURNER SLEEPER) (made in china wonder the quality of insulation used health wise) has a slight smell when I breathed inside bag tightened
customer_reviews.author: Dennis2016

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a bigger guy!
customer_reviews.text: I am 6'2" 275lbs. I also am a stomach sleeper and like to move around alot. This bag is perfect! I can lay on my stomach, hands above my head, and still have plenty of room in the bag. It is wide enough that my 8 year old daughter was able to wiggle her way in as well, and I still had room to move. It is by no means light, and it does not pack very small, but a good night sleep is more important to me. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: If I could rate these ten stars, I would! I bought them because I hate being confined in a sleeping bag and loooove how wide they are. We just went camping and it got down to 32 degrees but we were toasty warm! Great quality and the flannel like material inside feels great without sticking to your clothes like flannel does. They also pack really easily into their stuff sacks. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Warm, but bulky.....
customer_reviews.text: We recently purchased two of these bags for some cooler weather camping. By no means was it backpack type camping, as these are pretty heavy. However, these served the purpose and were quite spacious. I would say 30° was approximately the lowest temperature. We were both comfortable and actually at one point wound up unzipping a bit. Would definitely recommend. Happy camping!
customer_reviews.author: kfrie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sleeping bag from Teton, This is now the 5th sleeping bag I have bought from Teton brand. The whole family gets the good sleeping bags now. This was used in temperatures in the low 40's and not once did we get cold. In fact it was so warm that you didn't need to be tightly bundled in it during the night. Other reviews complain about the lining isn't flannel cotton, as nice as flannel cotton is, it really makes it much heavier and honestly just isn't needed. I didn't miss it a bit.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and warm
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag because I'm a plus sized woman and wanted elbow room. It is more than enough roomy, longer than I need at 5'6". It's puffy and plenty warm...very cozy. I'll NEVER get it back into the bag though. It's very large for the bag and the fabric is slippery so it doesn't fold easily. I put it in a vacuum sealed bag and even with the air sucked out, it is still huge on the shelf. For me, it's a worthwhile price for a comfortable bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Shore lady

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Love these sleeping bags. Very warm, puffy and lots of room so you dont feel claustrophobic! They are about the size of a twin bed. My husband and I bought 2 for ourselves, and another brand for the kids 3 years ago. Their bags fell apart. I just bought my kids these ones because we love ours. And eventhough they are roomy. Your feet and legs aren't cold. Actually, my husband has to sleep with his open because they're too hot for most summer nights, but just opening it, gives him the comfort he desires.
customer_reviews.author: Dpancoast

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6"8 and this is the first sleeping bag I've actually felt comfortable in since I was 13. It has a nice high-quality zipper which makes it super easy to get in and out of. The quality is very good overall and this bag is nice and warm on cold nights. I also really love the inside material they use, it's very cozy. In conclusion I'm very happy with this purchase and would recommend this sleeping bag to anyone. I look forward to many more enjoyable nights with my new favorite sleeping bag :)
customer_reviews.author: Dude

customer_reviews.title: So roomy and soft!
customer_reviews.text: The only problem that I found with my sleeping bag is that it is very hard to stuff in the bag. I would still prefer the old roll up. Other than that this is the best sleeping bag that I have ever purchased. I absolutely love it it is so big and roomy and soft. I definitely will keep it forever. I just need to become a better Stuffer.
customer_reviews.author: Doreen3303

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! The night I slept in this, the weather temp got down into the lower 20's. I had a liner, jeans and sweatshirt, along with two pairs of socks and was very warm. Ended up giving this to my son the next night since he said he froze in his sleeping bag. When he woke up the next morning, he said he wasn't cold. He did not use a liner and the temperature was around 26F. Will keep this in mind when I need to order another sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Smile2day

customer_reviews.title: not as I had planned but still a great sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.text: The sleeping bag is very nice and well-made and definitely will keep you warm. My only complaint is that once you get in the sleeping bag it is very very hard to zip it up from inside. And once I unzipped it all the way down to the bottom it took me a very long time to get the zipper back together. I don’t know whether that was my fault and what I was doing or if it was the way the sleeping bag was made. It is a very good sleeping bag though so I am glad I purchased it it’s just “harder to use “then I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Jb

customer_reviews.title: This bag gets hot!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this particular bag because of its large size. I like to sleep sprawled out and cold (70 degrees) so my review may be best for those who like similar temps when sleeping. I had a trip to Johnson Valley CA planned and it said it would be 7-37 degrees. Set the camper at 60 degrees and I was burning up. Set it to 40 degrees and I was just right. However, when its that cold and you have to you get up in the am, you don't want to get out of your bag to turn on the heat!
customer_reviews.author: SweetJillian88

customer_reviews.title: Like a warm burrito
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough great things about the Teton bag I purchased! I slept in the back of my 4Runner on a below freezing night in Denver a few times with some foil insulation on the windows and this bag, several times I had to open the zipper because I was getting TOO warm! Packs up nicely, not as small as I would like but definitely not overly bulky. This has been a life saver!
customer_reviews.author: jason p

customer_reviews.title: Very warm and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sleeping bag. We just went camping at 11,000 ft and it was cold at night. I slept toasty and cozy in this bag. It would be great to have a zipper on both sides and it came with quite a few threads hanging off that could get caught and snag. Simple fix to snip them, but definitely want to check before using. Even compressed it is quite substantial, but the pay off for a roomy and cozy warm bag are worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Elizastitch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Went to Death Valley, temperature range is from 150 F during the day to low 20s F at night. The day I went it dropped to 32 F at night and a lot of wind. This sleeping bag kept me warm no problems, it works and you won't be cold. The only issue is that you cannot wash it, and normally when I go camping I do not shower, so being able to wash would be nice, but not big issue.
customer_reviews.author: Always right

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you warm FOR SURE.
customer_reviews.text: No joke slept in 35 -39 degree weather and I was perfectly warm. Not to the point where I was sweating and uncomfortable. The reason I gave a 4 star for light weight, because it's a bit heavy and not easy to roll up and put away in the bag that is provided.
customer_reviews.author: TakAra

customer_reviews.title: Great 3 season bag
customer_reviews.text: My little dachshund and I have used this sleeping bag for the past 4 years and we go camping multiple times a year. My lifestyle has outgrown the bag. It was great and held up through out many nights in the tent. Be advised, this bag is huge, but light for its size. I don’t recommend it in late fall/winter settings though.
customer_reviews.author: A.Y

customer_reviews.title: TETON Sports Celsius XXL -18C/0F Sleeping Bag;...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. Material makes you very warm. 2. Rolls up nice and compact. Cons: 1. The inside material is not soft flannel. More like slick polyester. 2. The zipper is only on one side of the bag. If you plan on using this for a blanket or a layer for your kids pallet, find something else. There is no zipper down by your feet. 3. You can not machine wash or dry clean this sleeping bag. The tag says hand wash and lay flat to dry, Well it can't lay flat cause the zipper does not go curve down around your feet. I can see cleaning this outside on the picnic table with a water hose.
customer_reviews.author: James C Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bags! Zip em together and voila!!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING BAG! I purchased the right zip and left zip XXL 0 degree bags and zipped those babies together. They fit perfect (maybe a touch big) on our queen size mattress. Our family of 3 slept extremely comfortable on a 35 degree damp night. We were so warm the first night we slept in shorts the second night. I did throw in two lightweight small blankets just because I like to cuddle up with something. The bag is my new obsession and I can’t wait to do some winter tenting!! Pack and unpacks really simple also.
customer_reviews.author: Sara M.

customer_reviews.title: Like sleeping in a nice fluffy cloud
customer_reviews.text: I camped out in 34 F degree weather for a whole week and I was comfortable and warm without being too hot. I am 5'5" and weight 125lbs and did not pay attention to the size (XXL) when I placed my order, but I have no regrets. The extra padding around the shoulders kept me warm and cozy with plenty of room for a blanket (which I didn't need to use). The compression bag is strong quality but bulky and probably not ideal for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Rohan

customer_reviews.title: Toasty Warm
customer_reviews.text: I use this sleeping bag for tent camping in Ohio. Typically it gets down to 25 degrees. The bag keeps me warm with only a PJ bottom and a long sleeve T-Shirt. I am 5-10 and weigh 190 lbs. There is plenty of room to move around. I use a cot as air mattresses leak. Zipper works great. Stop freezing and buy this bag. It is rated for zero degrees. However works well at 25 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: BlueGolfer

customer_reviews.title: Best sleeping bag I have
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bag for my trips on my Harley, I have it in a waterproof compression bag and its not as heavy as you would think. It's huge and I had an oversize bag that wasn't wide enough for my shoulders, this bag allows me to roll around without having the bag roll with me. its really comfortable and warm, the flannel material in the bag is really comfortable. I would recommend this for anyone looking for a extra large sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warm and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this bag twice now, and while everyone was complaining about being cold at 30 degree weather, I was nice and warm and very comfortable because of the padding! I would def recommend this bag! I will say, it’s def not light at all! It stuffs into a stuff bag, and it’s huge and heavy! Def not something I would take on a hike.... but very much for a reg old camping trip with the family!
customer_reviews.author: GBrouillette

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag!
customer_reviews.text: I was in need of a new sleeping bag for some fall tent camping. I love this bag! It’s warm and so comfy. I got the XXL not for romantic cuddles with the boy, but for my German shorthair, who not only is the hottest body I know, but loves to sleep right up against me inside my sleeping bag, acting as my personal heater. It was about 40 degrees on the night that I first used this bag, and it was toasty warm. I’m am going on a late season trip middle of November to the shores of Lake Michigan, so I will update and let you know if I survived :)
customer_reviews.author: madcityizzy

customer_reviews.title: Roomy & warm!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a sleeping bag for a backpack trip in cold weather. The weight made me hesitate, but a review claiming to have backpacked with it made me go for it. I did a short 2 day/1 night hike with this monster - comfy! But no way is it going on my 20 day trip. Loved the room. Loved the warmth. Weight is too much for backpacking anything major.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki J.

customer_reviews.title: Best sleeping bag ever!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this sleeping bag!!! These are super warm and kept us super warm when it got down to the teens. I love how fluffy the sleeping bags feel on the inside and how truly comfortable they were. They also stuffed back into their bags perfectly and it took no time at all which was awesome. I have been recommending these sleeping bags to all my friends and co-workers and may even by another set for the summer months. My favorite sleeping bags yet!
customer_reviews.author: A. James

customer_reviews.title: Big enough for a big man, and kept me warm in the cold nights!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this sleeping bag for a camping trip to Yellowstone. Nights on the trip were regularly in the 30s, but this bag kept me very warm, even when the rest of the family was cold in their bags. Also, I am a big man, and I had plenty of room (both height and width) to stay warm and comfortable. Would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Star Wars Fan

customer_reviews.title: Good value, warm in 40degF (4 degC)
customer_reviews.text: The fabric inside isn't a true flannel, but is still nice and soft. I climbed inside at about 11 am on a Saturday to test it out and woke up 3 days later confused but profoundly comfortable. I can't recommend this item if you ever need to do things again that can't be done inside this sleeping bag. It comes with a stuff sack which is excellent (if you ever manage to escape its cozy clutches)
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Prince

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and Lightweight! But not 7'6"
customer_reviews.text: I just received my bag a few days ago and its so comfortable!!! Im a taller guy, (6'2) so its hard for me to find a sleeping bag i can fit in. When i saw that this bag is advertised at 7'6" I was very excited and ordered right away. I just fit into the bag perfect like a glove but my feet are at the end. So i wouldn't recommend to anyone taller then 6'2". I dont know why its advertised being so tall when its over a foot off. Besides that I love the bag and I look forward to staying nights in it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Davey

customer_reviews.title: Best sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Just got done hunting in central Wisconsin this is my favorite sleeping bag I’ve ever owned. It’s warm but breaths enough to not make you sweat, which has been my problem with northface mummy bags. The size is perfect and the hood is really nice. I highly recommend this, however if you’re going to Alaska or doing any extreme environment activities you would want a -30 degree bag.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Lesher

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it! Very comfortable and warm
customer_reviews.text: Love this sleeping bag! It came with a small tear but the quality outweighs the blemish. Used it twice in about 40-50 degree weather and sweat. Super comfortable and snuggly. Not enough room for two squirmy people I will buy one each for my family members and an extra for friends. Makes colder camping easy.
customer_reviews.author: D.J.D

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and fit
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. At 6'2" 240 I'm a big guy and this sleeping bag was plenty big for me. Very comfortable and kept me warm too. I was skeptical about stuffing it back into the carry bag any way I want but it went in as advertised. The zipper like any sleeping bag needs to be zipped up slowly and carefully to keep it from pinching material but if you pay attention to what you are doing there is no problem. I have taken this bag out on three different trips and no complaints. Glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Dug

customer_reviews.title: Best bag I’ve owned
customer_reviews.text: The material is very soft not flannel material that is too hot but not cold feeling either. These are best sleep bags I’ve owned camped in 35 degree weather and was very comfortable. The size is a major plus fit my dog and my plus size self inside zipped up. Goes good with the Teton xxl cot and pad.
customer_reviews.author: Danthman51

customer_reviews.title: Roomy, warm, comfortable and the right price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag for the fire house. it can be super cold and this is almost too much. It’s extremely comfortable and holds heat very well. Im excited to take it camping instead. I got a bigger bag because I like leg room. I’m 5’11” and have more than a foot of extra space and i have room to roll back and forth without getting twisted up. I’d buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Austin Glover

customer_reviews.title: Nice features and compression bag is great
customer_reviews.text: I'm really enjoying my new sleeping bag. I didn't realize just how big it is, but I'm glad I got it. Very warm and I love the pocket at the top for my phone or small flashlight. One thing I learned by watching a lot of videos online and getting frustrated first - don't try to "roll" this bag back up to get it into the bag like other sleeping bags. It's just better to fold it over lengthwise and then start stuffing and turning from one end. Compression bag is great in keeping it all compact when you're finished.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Jones

customer_reviews.title: I like this sleeiping bag
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6' tall and I like lots of room. This xxL size bag fits me well. While I haven't used this in freezing temps this would make for a nice blanket as well. Seems to be of excellent quality and fits nicely into the compression bag. Speaking of the bag, this has very nice straps to help with compression..
customer_reviews.author: kayak99

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag saved my life. It kept me warm in 20 degree weather. it is very easy to roll up and return it to the bag when not being used. My one complaint is I bought the bigger size and the smaller would have probably worked as well. I would highly recommend if you are camping somewhere cold.
customer_reviews.author: GENEVA JAMES

customer_reviews.title: Warm. Really warm.
customer_reviews.text: Went camping in sub freezing weather and wasn’t just warm... we were hot. This is a very warm bag. Not for summer. But for fall and winter it’s great. We zipped it together with one of their mammoth bags and had me, my wife, my toddler, and enough room for another person or two. Getting it into the compression bag is a chore but that’s kind of expected.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Twinkie

customer_reviews.title: great bag
customer_reviews.text: Are you a big person? I am 6' 1" 285 and a mummy bag just does not work. This bag is big and warm with a flannel lining. I took this camping in 17 degree F, and it was toasty. It does weigh more then a mummy bag, so if you are backpacking, you need to take that into consideration; but I drive up in my Jeep and camp, so the excess weight is not a factor. , Zipper works great with no snags.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Branch

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it...
customer_reviews.text: Very dissapointing... Appears bulky/worm...not too heavy but certainly not for backpacking/bikepacking. Used it at most 10 times on and results... Seams that hold two sides started to separate, seams holding interior fabric to insulation coming loose, zipper constanly snags, and it appears insulation in few spots tore/separated and created lumps. Returning it right back.
customer_reviews.author: VIBEN

customer_reviews.title: Issue with the zipper.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It is comfortable, cozy, and large enough for a tall person. The only issue I had with it is the Main zipper gets stuck in the baffle on the edge. Especially if you are in the bag and try to close it all the way up. The zipper got caught on the fabric and thank God there is another zipper at the bottom, otherwise, I would have been stuck in the bag without a way out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Capote

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.text: The sleeping bag is big. I’m a huge dude who needs space in his bag. This works to perfection. The feeling of this sleeping bag is very high quality. It does the job. I think this will last quite some time. It’s a larger bag so just note that it’s a lot to put away when it’s time to pack up. I’m satisfied with my purchase and love the color of it.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Crunch

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Bag
customer_reviews.text: I have slept in this bag on a cot in several different situations. My tent has reached well below freezing and I didn't even notice I was so warm and comfortable. Note: I see some people give negative reviews on bags because they got cold by sleeping on cold ground. Always use some type of insulated barrier between you and the cold ground... or you will always be freezing!
customer_reviews.author: andy s.

customer_reviews.title: Very Big and Very Soft
customer_reviews.text: I will not be taking this behemoth backpacking, THAT'S for sure. It will stay in my truck for emergencies and that's why I bought it. Good price point for my needs. Everything checked out upon inspection. Good zipper, low "noise" level fabric, soft and beefy. Very LARGE bag. No Zipper at bottom of bag only on the side (I knew this going in) Excellent quality. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ONightbird

customer_reviews.title: Big camperman will love
customer_reviews.text: So these are big! And comfort is everywhere! They are warm but don't have giant mega puffiness. So I'm not sure what they're using but it is 2017 and I'd expect that something can be invented to keep you warm and not have to be stay puff huge! Looooove the fleece lining. I sometimes nap in these at my house because they are THAT comfortable. No joke.
customer_reviews.author: BillTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and roomy
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with these bags. They are very warm. The bags are very roomy. I couldn't believe how they just stuffed right back into their bag. I love all the buckles and the draw string on the bag. They pack small enough for car camping but too big for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Cobbie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Sleeping Bag!
customer_reviews.text: Oh this is fantastic. I took this camping twice in varying weather and it held up! I warm and dry in 36 degree weather and in wet 57 degree weather. I love the extra space this allows and the option for a zipper on either side. The colors are cozy and perfect. I have nothing but positive things to say.
customer_reviews.author: smitrya06

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for anyone
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is amazing. I'm a smaller woman (5'5, 115lbs) but I like to move around when I sleep and this bag is perfect for me, it's huge. For my feet to touch the end I would have to be completely engulfed by this sleeping bag. It is very warm for myself, and I'm always cold. As another review stated, the temperature rating is the absolute lowest temperature you could be in without dying. After camping in mid/upper 40s I wouldn't want to be in any colder weather in this bag without putting a ton of layers on. I had a very thick sweatshirt, pants and socks on and I was very warm.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for cold nights
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping bag. Uses while it was below freezing, somewhere in the upper 20's-F and was plenty toasty. I use this as a Left and a Right zipper so that my wife and I can sleep in the same bag. I'd say the total size of the two zipped together is about the same as a queen size mattress. Bought these on the reccomnedation of friends. Well worth the money. Fabric is comfortable as well. Get a Right zip and a Left zip if you want to make one big bag.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Dilks

customer_reviews.title: Lots of room in this sleeping bag !
customer_reviews.text: Used this sleeping bag for the first time last weekend while camping in a national forest. It got down below freezing and I was toasty warm while sleeping. I'm a larger guy, over 6ft and I have plenty of room in this bag, that was the main issue with other sleeping bags I've bought. My wife wants one now so we can zip them together. Great purchase and I will be using it again this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: treyisthename

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for car camping
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag! I'm not huge, 5' 10" 185lbs, but I sprawl when I sleep. I had a mummy bag before this and could never get comfortable. I can lay in this bag in my stomach with both elbows out to the sides and my legs in a "figure 4" position and I still have room off​ to the sides. It's warm. Really warm. I was 40° last night and I ended up unzipping it most of the way, but it is so big that I could use it like a thick comforter and still be warm. The only downside is that it's heavy, so it wouldn't be suitable for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought this bag sooner, it's fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is too big for backpacking, I should say it's too heavy for backpacking. However, it is absolutely perfect for car camping. This thing is so big you might be able to get two people in there, but for me it's like having a full-size bed to roll around in. I love this thing! You can't go wrong if you're looking for extra room or if you're a big guy like me. It's perfection.
customer_reviews.author: BrainSpout

customer_reviews.title: Well made. Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This is well made and good quality. I did however end up buying another from a different brand because it was bigger. If size is what you want get the Tough Outdoors Collosal sleeping bag. The Teton however is probably slightly better quality even though I am satisfied with the Tough Outdoors and enjoy the added size and the fact that the Tough Outdoors zips totally open.
customer_reviews.author: David W

customer_reviews.title: Really nice warm sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag is super cozy. My only complaint is it doesn't unzip all the way. It's a deal breaker for me and had I realized that it didn't I would not have purchased it. I traded it with my husband as his does unzip all the way and he loves it and so do the dogs
customer_reviews.author: terrifficteaze

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t feel XXL.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t stand the zipper, it keeps getting caught on the material inside. The material on the outside is so slick I keep sliding off my camp pad. XXL doesn’t mean much that I can tell. I’m not that wide and I feel trapped. I guess I have to get the mammoth sleeping bag if I want to move around.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua C.

customer_reviews.title: a sleeping bag that for the first time was actually big enough for my six foot five frame to fit in comfortably.
customer_reviews.text: the recent winter storm in my area forced me to live out of my truck for several days, given that the average temperature was around seventeen degrees this was worrisome on my part. thankfully I had purchased a sleeping bag rated for this, a sleeping bag that for the first time was actually big enough for my six foot five frame to fit in comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Who Ate The Kandy?

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag but be Careful with all the Spec. Picks
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these bags and it is great. Good for my allergies and is perfect of cabin and camping. Super comfortable with very soft materials. Feels like a cloud. The bag maintains a good fluff of air that is the key to warmth at the same time, compresses neatly into the travel bag. However, be very careful when ordering. There are so many options that sneak up on you. Right zip is your right hand when you are laying in the bag. Also, the size is NOT a pic. It is the headline. I over-looked that and got a XXL by mistake. Not sure how to exchange for a Regular.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get This Bag!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this bag!!!! It is not a backpacking bag, but it is great for car camping. This thing is so soft and warm (I am a dude, 6' 2" inches) and there is a lot of room! It puffs up really big with your body warmth and holds its shape and warmth very well. I hate those silly mummy bags that make you feel so cramped and constricted, so this bag is my dream bag. I love this bag so much, I use it as my night-time blanket at home (I live in the cold northern portion of the Mid-West). Really comfy when camping as well--puffy and cozy. Get this!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ju Hyun Lee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cold weather camping
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for cold weather camping. Camped in 28 degree weather in a tent. Actually was hot in boxers and teeshirt. This product lives up to its name and very roomy inside to. I don't feel trapped like a mummy bag. Lining in nice, flannel pattern but not actual flannel. Which is good cause I think that would be to hot. I read a lot of negative reviews. It sounds like those people just have no clue and demand an app for instant satisfaction for everything.
customer_reviews.author: R Deemer

customer_reviews.title: Not a soft flannel lining at all
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with the inside of the bag. It says flannel. It’s more like a cotton bed sheet. The bag is roomy, and the zippers pull well. ... And after using it for December trip in great Smoky Mountain national Park, I had to upgrade my original post to four stars. It was very cold, some nights in the teens, but I was warm and comfortable. If I had to choose between a softer flannel, and being so warm, I would definitely choose the warmth.
customer_reviews.author: Jessy Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Met expectations
customer_reviews.text: Got (4) of these for camping in Yellowstone. Boy am I glad we had these as it got in the lower 40’s in June 2018. Kids and wife stayed warm. Only complaint is the Velcro zipper keeper ripped off my bag, hence the (4) star rating. Would buy again. The stuff sack is of good quality and packs down nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Great for 6'3" 350lbs.
customer_reviews.text: I struggle with bags that are just too narrow. I've split zippers in regular bags just breathing. This one is plenty wide for my shoulders. I took it camping in 40 deg and got too hot at times. It packs rather large though. It takes up a lot of room in my backpack. It would be great for truck-camping, but I'm going to look for something a little thinner to take backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable in size, fabric and warmth.  Huge value
customer_reviews.text: I just spent two nights outdoors in the Sierras. The temp probably dropped to 25, and I only felt a smallest tinge of chill at that one point, one of the nights. I was wearing shorts and a T-shirt. Just adding socks and I would have been toasty! Super comfortable , good size. My only “complaint” is that the zipper is so smooth, that it kinda opens on its own if not velcroed closed at the top.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Great bag. Lining was very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very warm bag. Came in very handy for mid winter camping in TX when overnight temp suddenly dropped from the 60's to upper 20's. Only reason on getting 5 stars is this bag is near impossible to put back into back by yourself. I had to do a weird maneuver of holding bag open with teeth. Laying on the bag as I rolled it and using arms and body to hold it down to get one end inside the bag to then squeeze it in. Other than the repacking it. Great bag. Lining was very comfortable. And so far has held up to multiple washes in a front loading machine.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Diehl

customer_reviews.title: Fabrics soft and comfortable. Plenty of room to move your legs around
customer_reviews.text: Pros-This sleeping bag was large and warm. Fabrics soft and comfortable. Plenty of room to move your legs around. The zipper was constructed well. Compact. Fit into the carrying bag well. Cons-The red lining bled. Stained my white underwear pink. That was hard to explain to my wife. And the biggest con is that it is not machine washable and no dry clean......hand wash ONLY! Are you kidding me? We put it into the washer anyway and dried it in the dryer on air. This voids the warranty, but who cares. I'm not hand washing a freaking sleeping bag by hand. So it lived to be used another day!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Field tested
customer_reviews.text: 10 day hunt trip with this at about 11000 feet. Temps down to 10 degs. Sleeping on a mat. Below 20 degs, you want another layer. Liner or thermal undies. I like the room it has, nice and comfy. Did get some condensation underneath, but that's to be expected. I am 6' 3" at 240 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff B

customer_reviews.title: Big and warm
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a 30 degree bag after being very cold in 45 degrees. I would recommend this bag down to about 30 degrees. Remember that the temperature rating on sleeping bags does not mean you will be comfortable at that temp, it just means that you won't freeze to death.
customer_reviews.author: Offshore

customer_reviews.title: Very roomy and warm.
customer_reviews.text: Finding the right sleeping bag has been a challenge for me because I'm a voluptuous woman and because I'm a side sleeper. This bag solve both of those problems and I feel snug as a bug in it. Only con is, it is a little heavier than a normal bag, but worth it for the roominess.
customer_reviews.author: Selah88

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I had a chance to use this a couple times this year and I loved it. I'm a larger framed person, so I wanted a much larger sleeping bag as I tend to move around in my sleep and can't stand feeling restricted. There is plenty of room in this sleeping bag. Even when the temperature outside was 35F, I felt great inside this bag. The zipper works great. I read some reviews where people complained it wasn't "flannel" on the inside. Read the description first. It's "poly-flannel". If you want an actual flannel lining on the inside, then go buy a different bag. Anyhow, this is a great sleeping bag overall.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A high quality XXL bag for XXL people.
customer_reviews.text: I have had problems with sleeping bags that don't provide enough shoulder room (I roll when I sleep). This bag provides a lot of shoulder room while still cinching a little bit (a little like a mummy bag) at the top so all the heat does not escape. I am a bigger man 6'2" 250 pounds and have camped with the bag in 40 degree and 15 degree weather. I put on warm pajamas for the colder night and was just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Large, warm, and effective
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this bag for almost all of winter and I have to say it's a great product. I used it for car camping and indoors and it has kept me nice and toasty almost always. For cold temperatures around 22F, I do suggest wearing layers to bed as well.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Lee

product_meta.title: TETON Sports 101R Celsius XXL -18C/0F Sleeping Bag; 0 Degree Sleeping Bag Great for Cold Weather Camping; Black, Right Zip
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Size:90" x 39" Right ZipWhen you need a great sleeping bag to come back to after a long day on the trail, choose the Celsius XXL Sleeping Bag, by TETON Sports. This three-season sleeping bag was built to last a lifetime. It’s filled with innovative fiber fill that keeps you warm and is rated to below freezing temperatures. The mummy-style hood can cinch in around your head for additional warmth and keeps your pillow clean. Its durable shell will stand up to years of rigorous adventuring. It’s a warm, comfortable sleeping bag that’s soft to the touch, but don’t take our word for it—read the reviews! The Celsius XXL is keeping thousands of car campers happy in The Great Outdoors.
feature_bullets: COMFORTABLE SLEEPING BAG FOR ADULTS: Soft lining; Half-circle mummy style hood keeps you warm and your pillow clean; Unzips at the top or bottom for easy access and ventilation; For camping in 3 seasons
NEVER ROLL YOUR SLEEPING BAG AGAIN: TETON provides a great compression sack for stuffing your sleeping bag; Start at the bottom and stuff the bag in, then tighten the heavy-duty straps
STAY WARM IN COLD WEATHER: You’ll be warm and rested in this sleeping bag; Innovative fiber fill, double-layer construction and draft tubes work together to keep the warmth in
SLEEP WARM: Fluff your sleeping bag and use a camp pad to sleep warmer; Hang loops for long-term storage to maintain maximum loft
TETON SPORTS PROMISE: Reach out to our AMAZING product support team if you have any questions or concerns; YOU CAN COUNT ON US to get you taken care of and back OUTDOORS with TETON Sports

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
